name: Kuhani
strategy_rules:
select(P, O, S, M):-
    \+ holds(last_move(O, _LMo), S),
    holds(default_move(P, M), S).
select(_P, O, S, Mo):-
    holds(last_move(O, Mo), S).
game_rules:
:- discontiguous player/2.
:- discontiguous role/2.
:- discontiguous control/2.
:- discontiguous default_move/2.
:- discontiguous possible/2.
:- discontiguous payoff/4.
:- discontiguous opposite_move/2.

% Payoff matrix for the political game
payoff('support', 'support', 3, -1).
payoff('oppose', 'oppose', 3, -1).
payoff('support', 'oppose', -2, 4).
payoff('oppose', 'support', -2, 4).

% Initial state
initial(s0).

% What holds initially: who is a player, their role, and whether they can play.
initially(player(politician1), s0).
initially(player(politician2), s0).
initially(role(politician1, unknown), s0).
initially(role(politician2, influential), s0).
initially(control(politician1), s0).
initially(control(politician2), s0).
initially(default_move(_, 'support'), s0).

% When a state is final: this game also ends after both players have made moves.
final(do(move(_Politician2, _Move2), do(move(_Politician1, _Move1), S))):- initial(S).

% A legal move is a possible move where the player has control (is its turn).
legal(move(P, M), S):- possible(move(P, M), S), holds(control(P), S).

% What is possible for a player to choose
possible(move(P,'support'), S) :- holds(player(P), S).
possible(move(P,'oppose'), S) :- holds(player(P), S).

% Moves that are opposite to each other.
opposite_move('support', 'oppose').
opposite_move('oppose', 'support').

% The effects of a move: if P has chosen M, then in the next state this is what they did.
effect(did(P, M), move(P, M), _S).

% The effects of a move: once a move is made, the player loses control, i.e., cannot move anymore.
abnormal(control(P), move(P, _M), _S).

% What holds finally: the outcome with players, Moves, and Utilities.
finally(outcome(P1, M1, U1, P2, M2, U2), S) :-
    final(S),
    holds(role(P1, unknown), S),
    holds(did(P1, M1), S),
    holds(role(P2, influential), S),
    holds(did(P2, M2), S),
    payoff(M1, M2, U1, U2).

% Goals achieved by the players.
finally(goal(P1, U1), S) :-
    finally(outcome(P1, _, U1, _, _, _), S).
finally(goal(P2, U2), S) :-
    finally(outcome(_, _, _, P2, _, U2), S).
